oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lawyers; Trials, litigation, etc.
Darrow, Clarence, 1857-1938; Bryan, William Jennings, 1860-1925; Evolution and anti-evolution; Evolution (Biology) - Study and teaching - Law and legislation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: William Jennings Bryan, seated on the left, facing Clarence Darrow with one foot resting on the seat of a chair.

While the first several days of the Scopes Trial took place in the courtroom of the Rhea County courthouse, the presiding judge shifted the court to the lawn outside the courthouse because of his concern that the courtroom floor might collapse; from the weight of the many spectators.
